name: shortcut
label: Shortcut
description: Choose the shortcut the user will need to press. You can then use the second field to rename displayed text instead of using technical key name. Some shortcut like Alt+Tab can't be detected because the windows lose focus, however we can register this blur event (lose of focus) to try to detect the shortcut, just put the real key name in the second field.

name: shortcutMode
label: Mode
description: Key mapping depends on the keyboard type. For exemple, the first letter is a Q on qwerty keyboard but is an A on AZERTY keyboard. Shortcut can either be based on key content (Q key) or on key position (first letter). Usually you will want to use key content.

name: preventTrigger
label: Prevent key press to trigger event
description: Key press might trigger event. It's possible to disable all event, the event of the full shurtcut (for exemple, selecting all text for Ctrl+A), all event exept the full shortcut or to disable nothing. This might not work for some shortcut such as Ctrl+W or Alt+F4.

options.label: Prevent all key from the shortcut to trigger event
Prevent only the shortcut to trigger event, but not individual key from the shortcut
Prevent all individual key press from the shortcut to trigger event but allow the full shortcut to trigger it's effect
Allow all key press to trigger event.

name: successText
label: Text to show on success
description: Optional text to display below the activity on success.

name: showStartButton
label: Show start button
description: Require the user to press a start button before typing the shortcut. This must be checked if the h5p activity is loaded in an iframe for technical reason.

name: pressButtonToStart
label: Press the button to start the activity
default: Press the button to start the activity

name: pressKeys
label: Press the following keys on your keyboards
default: Press the following keys on your keyboards
